revised_title: Taxonomic and Stratigraphic Revision of Fossil Vole Remains in Lower Pleistocene Deposits of Eastern England
tldr: This study reviews the fossil vole remains (Rodentia, Microtinae) from the Lower Pleistocene deposits in eastern England, focusing on the Norwich Crag and Cromer Forest-bed Formations. The authors recognize several vole species and describe two new species, Mimomys pitymyoides and Mimomys gensis, for the first time from Britain. The research helps clarify the relative position of the Bramertonian and Pre-Pastonian stages and contributes to the understanding of the British Lower Pleistocene assemblages.
